snippet: A man who has been convicted three times in the 1992 murder of an 11-year-old baby sitter in suburban Chicago was released from prison on Friday.
abstract: Juan Rivera, who has been convicted three times in a 1992 murder in suburban Chicago, is released from prison after a local prosecutor decides not to challenge an appellate court ruling that reversed his last conviction; DNA evidence along with a lack of physical evidence led an appellate court to throw out his conviction.
lead_paragraph: A man who has been convicted three times in the 1992 murder of an 11-year-old baby sitter in suburban Chicago was released from prison on Friday.

headline.main: Illinois: Inmate Cleared by DNA Is Freed
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Inmate Cleared By DNA Is Freed
